bibl.title: Baking Bread in Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: The pre-Roman background. - The Eastern Desert sites. [The main evidence is from Mons Claudianus and Mons Porphyrites.] - The ceramic evidence from the Roman period. - Egypt's place in the Roman world.

bibl.title: "Functional Aspects of Egyptian Ceramics in their Archaeological Context. Proceedings of a Conference held at the McDonald Institute for Archaeological Research, Cambridge, July 24th - July 25th, 2009"

bibl.seg: Roberta Tomber, Baking Bread in Roman Egypt.

Bettina Bader & Mary F. Ownby (edd.), Functional Aspects of Egyptian Ceramics in their Archaeological Context. Proceedings of a Conference held at the McDonald Institute for Archaeological Research, Cambridge, July 24th - July 25th, 2009 = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 217 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2013) pp. 119-137, 3 figg.

The pre-Roman background. - The Eastern Desert sites. [The main evidence is from Mons Claudianus and Mons Porphyrites.] - The ceramic evidence from the Roman period. - Egypt's place in the Roman world.
